Down for the day. The way people spend money here you would hardly think there should be any envy of food. [???]

title: RuthAnn's postcard addressed to Richard J. Healey

creator: RuthAnn
subject: landscape

transcription: We arrived here June 7 - & expect to stay over Sunday. The prices are stiff and accommodations ordinary.Tables also ordinary. [???] the spot is naturally beautiful and everybody feels obliged to see it. Santa Barbara is the place for a long stay, all the prices every where go up feb 1st - they take outrageous advantage of the tourist season, Feb  and march are the packed months and a big season according to the newspapers - [???] ann.

transcription: Let me hear from you soon. Am coming to Parsons, Kans. either in Nov. or Jan. Wish I might see you.Any hopes, do you think? Best wishes - Hyette

title: Elsie Westerman's response to her lover Frank Westerman's Christmas postcard
description: A postcard with a New Year text
creator: Elsie Westermann
subject: text
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
Dear Frankie:
We received all your pretty Xmas cards and wish to thank you for them - especially your dear picture you sent to me. We all had a very Merry Xmas and hope you had the same.
Wishing you a  Happy New Year!
 Hope it won’t be long now before we see you.
Same as ever, Elsie

Chicago, Dec. 28, 1911
I wish you all a very joyous and New Year.
Hope to see you this summer.

With love,
Your cousin,
Emma

Dear Dasie,

Hattie and I went to Lynn to-day.

title: Tina's postcard addressed to Frank Westerman
description: A  postcard with a text
creator: Tina
subject: text
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
Dear Son Frank,
received a card from you from Frisco. Was glad to hear from you and to know you are on the back track.
You did not give any address — please write address very plainly.
Give regards to Con.
Hope you are both well.
We are quite well.

title: Ernest KJ's postcard addressed to Mary Thomas

creator: Ernest KJ
subject: landscape
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. transcription:
Have your mom [???] over yet?
How are they coming?
How far is Richmond Utah from S.L.C.?
I was out to Hannah yesterday, and Con’s mother and sisters were there also.
Enjoyed ourselves.
– Tina

transcription:
Miss Thomas,
I’m grateful for this opportunity given to me to be here in Washington. 
It’s just thrilling to me to be in such a historical place and with this host of Red X workers. Best Wishes

title: Harriett Westerman's Christmas postcard to Frank Westerman
description: A postcard with a text of a Christmas wish
creator: Harriett Westerman
subject: text
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
"Congratulations"
Rec. your card some few days ago, was very glad to hear from you – waiting for more information in regards of your card.
 We are all very well, hope you all are the same.
Still having lovely weather.
Go down to the beach every Sunday
Write me and tell me all the good news

With love from

title: Tina's postcard addressed to Frank Westerman
description: A postcard with a text of a Christmas wish
creator: Tina
subject: text
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
Belchertown
Dear sister, — Mamma has will send a letter tomorrow.
Doesn't it seem nice to get some rain.
We are all well and hope you are the same! It is lovely and cool here today. I am going berrying this afternoon.
Must close and send this along.
Love,
L. M. J.

My best,

title: Elsie Westerman's postcard to Frank Westerman
description: A Christmas postcard with a feminine figure
creator: Elsie Westerman
subject: people,text
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
Baltimore, 1916
Now Blanche, be sure and write to me soon for I like to hear from the folks up home.
I like this work fine.
Dear Friend Blanche,
This is the hospital where I am at and now when you come down here I want you to be sure and come around to see me.
If you come down here to visit your Aunt and stay any time at all why just call up here or if not why come around anyway even if only for a few minutes time.
From your friend,
Ruth

5th Journey — thru John LAAF — San Angelo, Texas.
Dear Pal —
I thought you perhaps you would like this card. This place here seems quite like home after being in Texas.

transcription:
Dresden, Lindenplatz(?) 4
5/2/1912
Many thanks for your dear card and your kind thoughts, and good wishes. Please give my kindest regards to [??] and the [??] [??]. Much love from yours Clara Shadowell, We got a beautiful winter.

title: Postcard addressed to everybody about Gladys having the mumps
description: A postcard showing a scenery from Lisbon Portugal
subject: landscape
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
Hello Everybody,
I shall have to postpone my visit but I’m not going to be discouraged by that, us girls were going down next Fri (next day after the -unclear- here. But Gladys has the mumps or something of the sort, not a bit sick but her face is swollen, so if all is in our favor we will be down next Tue or Wed.

description: A postcard showing a cityscape
creator: Denver
subject: landscape
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of California Santa Barbara and Juan Cobo Bentacourt. For other uses beyond free use, please contact Kwabena Agyare yeboah agyare@umail.ucsb.edu.
transcription:
June 13/ 27
My Dear Mrs. Chomer,
Here we are in this beautiful old city of Nurnberg. I thought maybe you would like to have a card from me from Germany. I sent one to you from Austria. Kindest regards to Mrs. Haltzermann and also to you.Sincerely yours, Mrs. Denver

German Transcription:
Viele liebe Grüße aus Frömmstadt senden: Heinz
 Jorge
 Ilse
 Hermin
Liebe Grüße Mimi
[Signatures]
 T. Hammer, Roland, J. Hilti,
 Günther Faiß, Bilgi,
 Inesari (or a similar name – unclear handwriting)
English Translation:
Many warm greetings from Frömmstadt from:
 Heinz
 Jorge
 Ilse
 Hermin
Best regards,
 Mimi
[Signatures]
 T. Hammer, Roland, J. Hilti,
 Günther Faiß, Bilgi,
 Inesari (uncertain due to handwriting)

description: 1 January A happy new year

Habana: Plaza de la Catedral
shady nook on the agawam river
Today I am thinking of you and wishing you may be very happy, and every day as it comes I shall be thinking of you and hoping you are happy
Happy New Year - May fair hope brighten years to come, and memory gild the past
A happy new year
he Bathing Beach at Revere Beach, Mass
Seagulls, Scavengers of Puget Sound
When you get a good thing -- hold tight
U.S. Capitol at Night, Wahington DD
Hollenbeck Park, Los Angeles
Happy be your christmas
It's just four days to Valentines. I think a lot of you and so I send this Ace of Hearts. Now look for numer two
Hardanger Furuberfossen
New Municipal Buildings - Sprinfield
With best Chritmas wishes
Baltimore Medical College, Baltimore, Md
